current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prevent the escapement of genetically altered salmon
		  in the United States, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Commerce, Science, and
			 Transportation

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Prevention of Escapement of
			 Genetically Altered Salmon in the United States
			 Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text:
Prohibition on
			 sale of genetically altered salmon

text.#text: It shall be unlawful for a person—

to have custody, control, or possession of,
			 with the intent to ship, transport, offer for sale, sell, or purchase a covered
			 fish, or a product containing covered fish, in interstate or foreign
			 commerce;

to release a
			 covered fish into a natural environment; or

to have custody,
			 control, or possession of a covered fish with the intent to release it into a
			 natural environment.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not apply to a fish, fish part, or product—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Prevention of Escapement of Genetically Altered Salmon in the United States Act/s:2/ss:a

text.#text:
under confined
			 use, or intended for confined use, for scientific research;

collected for the
			 purpose of enforcing this Act; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and any other Federal, State, or
			 tribal entity the

considers appropriate, reviews any
			 application requesting an action by a department or agency of the Federal
			 government to permit an act prohibited under

, including any

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Prevention of Escapement of Genetically Altered Salmon in the United States Act/s:2/ss:a

prepares a

finds the

section 102(2)(C) of the National

text.#text:
an environmental
			 risk analysis that assesses the potential direct and indirect impacts from
			 escapement of covered fish on wild and cultured fish stocks and environments
			 that may be exposed to such covered fish;

an assessment
			 of the costs of control or eradication of escaped covered fish; and

an assessment of
			 the potential economic damage in terms of loss of production or sales to
			 relevant wild and cultured fish stocks and environments from the escapement of
			 covered fish.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
when an action
			 involving covered fish, or a product containing covered fish is first
			 identified.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Prevention of Escapement of Genetically Altered Salmon in the United States Act/s:2/ss:b/p:3

text.#text: The

The provisions of this Act are in addition to, and
			 shall not affect the operation of, other Federal, State, or local laws
			 regulating a covered fish, or a product containing covered fish.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall prescribe such rules and
			 regulations as the

considers necessary to carry out the provisions of
			 this Act.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may enforce
			 section 2 in the same manner, by the same means, and with the same
			 jurisdiction, powers, and duties provided under

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
sections 308, 309, 310, and 311
			 of the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act/s:308,309,310,311

text.#text:

			 subject to the penalties, and entitled to the privileges and immunities, under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
sections 308, 309, 310, and 311 of the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Food and Drug Administration Amendments Act of 2007/s:1007

header.#text:
Report on risks
			 to wild fish stocks

text.#text: In this Act:

term.#tail:
means any operation,
			 undertaken within a secured, land-based facility, that involves a covered fish
			 controlled by specific measures that effectively prevent the covered fish from
			 having contact with and impact on the external environment, including
			 biological and physical confinement measures.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means a salmon or other
			 anadromous or marine fish, live or dead, including the gametes, fertilized
			 eggs, offspring, and descendants thereof, that is modified or produced through
			 the application of recombinant deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) technologies, using
			 DNA from an organism’s own genome or that of another species, which overcome
			 natural physiological reproductive barriers and which are not techniques used
			 in traditional breeding and selection.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
has the meaning given the term in section 1508.13 of title 40,
			 Code of Federal Regulations.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means an item manufactured or produced for sale or
			 use as food.

The
